meanings.definition: To transport (a sick or injured person) by helicopter for medical treatment.
meanings.sent1: The injured hiker was medevacked to the hospital after falling down the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The paramedics medevacked the car accident victim to the trauma center for urgent care.
meanings.sent3: The medevacked patient joked that flying in a helicopter was a unique way to get to the doctor.
meanings.sent4: The helicopter medevacked the injured skier off the snowy slope like a guardian angel.
meanings.sent5: The loud whirring of the helicopter blades signaled the arrival of the medevacked patient.

meanings.definition: The act of transporting a sick or injured person by helicopter for medical treatment.
meanings.sent1: The medevacked soldier shared his story of being rescued by helicopter during the battle.
meanings.sent2: The hospital's quick response team coordinated the medevacked of the injured cyclist to the ER.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected medevacked of the cat stuck in a tree became the talk of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The medevacked of the stranded camper highlighted the importance of emergency medical services.
meanings.sent5: The news report featured footage of the dramatic medevacked of the injured firefighter.
